meanings.definition: The quality or state of being strict or severe.
meanings.sent1: The stringency of the teacher's rules made the students behave.
meanings.sent2: The stringency of the law ensured everyone followed the rules.
meanings.sent3: The stringency of the referee's calls made the game intense.
meanings.sent4: The stringency of the judge's decision left no room for doubt.
meanings.sent5: The stringency of the security check made travelers feel safe.

meanings.definition: Strictness or severity in enforcing rules or standards.
meanings.sent1: The stringency of the manager's policies kept the workplace in order.
meanings.sent2: The stringency of the regulations prevented any shortcuts.
meanings.sent3: The stringency of the traffic laws surprised the new driver.
meanings.sent4: The stringency of the coach's training regimen pushed the athletes to their limits.
meanings.sent5: The stringency of the quality control process ensured top-notch products.
